title: Thug destroys family home by hurling firework through letterbox while family slept
text:

A house was completely destroyed by a fire after a reckless yob posted a firework through the letterbox, police say.

The thug struck at around 1.30am this morning and left the entire ground floor of the terraced home gutted by flames.

The rest of the building suffered heat and smoke damage, says Liverpool Echo .

Somehow the residents escaped the horror in Knowsley, Merseyside, uninjured.

But it is being treated as a suspected firework attack and that an investigation is now underway.

Disturbing photos taken at the scene today show a bright orange firework lodged in the letterbox for the front door.

A spokesman for Merseyside Police said it is looking into a possible arson.

(Image: Liverpool ECHO)

(Image: LIVERPOOL ECHO)

And firefighters, who spent more than two hours tackling the blaze, confirmed it was caused by a firework.

Two fire engines attended the incident.

The house remains cordoned while police make further enquiries.

Safety concerns regarding fireworks were highlighted this week when Sainsburys confirmed it will stop selling them ahead of Bonfire Night this year.

(Image: Liverpool ECHO)

The supermarket giant was praised by animal charities and pet owners.

A spokesperson for the Dogs Trust said: “Although they can look beautiful, fireworks can be very distressing for dogs when let off unexpectedly, and because they are so easily accessible all year-round, dog owners are on tenterhooks as to when their beloved pooch will next be frightened.

“We congratulate Sainsbury’s on their decision not to sell fireworks this year and would encourage others to do the same.”
description: Luckily, everyone inside the terraced property in Knowsley, Merseyside, avoided injury in the early hours
